channel.title: CLI Reference on sttr
channel.description: Recent content in CLI Reference on sttr

item.title: sttr
item.description: sttr # sttr is a fast and flexible string/text converter Synopsis # sttr is a command line tool that allows you to quickly apply various transformation operations on the input text. Complete documentation is available at https://github.com/abhimanyu003/sttr sttr [flags] Options # -h, --help help for sttr SEE ALSO # sttr base32-decode - Decode your base32 text sttr base32-encode - Encode your text to Base32 sttr base64-decode - Decode your base64 text sttr base64-encode - Encode your text to Base64 sttr camel - Transform your text to CamelCase sttr completion - generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell sttr count-chars - Find the length of your text (including spaces) sttr count-lines - Count the number of lines in your text sttr count-words - Count the number of words in your text sttr hex-rgb - Convert a #hex-color code to RGB sttr html-decode - Unescape your HTML sttr html-encode - Escape your HTML sttr interactive - Use sttr in interactive mode sttr json - Format your text as JSON sttr json-yaml - Convert JSON to YAML text sttr kebap - Transform your text to kebap-case sttr lower - Transform your text to lower case sttr md5-sum - Get the MD5 hash of your text sttr reverse - Reverse Text ( txeT esreveR ) sttr rot13-encode - Encode your text to ROT13 sttr sha1-sum - Get the SHA1 hash of your text sttr sha256-sum - Get the SHA256 hash of your text sttr sha512-sum - Get the SHA512 checksum of your text sttr slug - Transform your text to slug-case sttr snake - Transform your text to snake_case sttr title - Transform your text to Title Case sttr upper - Transform your text to UPPER CASE sttr url-decode - Decode URL entities sttr url-encode - Encode URL entities sttr version - Print the version of sttr sttr yaml-json - Convert YAML to JSON text sttr zeropad - Pad a number with zeros Auto generated by spf13/cobra on 26-Sep-2021 #

item.title: sttr completion
item.description: sttr completion # generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell Synopsis # Generate the autocompletion script for sttr for the specified shell. See each sub-command’s help for details on how to use the generated script. Options # -h, --help help for completion SEE ALSO # sttr - sttr is a fast and flexible string/text converter sttr completion bash - generate the autocompletion script for bash sttr completion fish - generate the autocompletion script for fish sttr completion powershell - generate the autocompletion script for powershell sttr completion zsh - generate the autocompletion script for zsh Auto generated by spf13/cobra on 26-Sep-2021 #

item.title: sttr completion bash
item.description: sttr completion bash # generate the autocompletion script for bash Synopsis # Generate the autocompletion script for the bash shell. This script depends on the ‘bash-completion’ package. If it is not installed already, you can install it via your OS’s package manager. To load completions in your current shell session: $ source <(sttr completion bash) To load completions for every new session, execute once: Linux: $ sttr completion bash > /etc/bash_completion.

item.title: sttr completion fish
item.description: sttr completion fish # generate the autocompletion script for fish Synopsis # Generate the autocompletion script for the fish shell. To load completions in your current shell session: $ sttr completion fish | source To load completions for every new session, execute once: $ sttr completion fish > ~/.config/fish/completions/sttr.fish You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect. sttr completion fish [flags] Options # -h, --help help for fish --no-descriptions disable completion descriptions SEE ALSO # sttr completion - generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell Auto generated by spf13/cobra on 26-Sep-2021 #

item.title: sttr completion powershell
item.description: sttr completion powershell # generate the autocompletion script for powershell Synopsis # Generate the autocompletion script for powershell. To load completions in your current shell session: PS C:> sttr completion powershell | Out-String | Invoke-Expression To load completions for every new session, add the output of the above command to your powershell profile. sttr completion powershell [flags] Options # -h, --help help for powershell --no-descriptions disable completion descriptions SEE ALSO # sttr completion - generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell Auto generated by spf13/cobra on 26-Sep-2021 #

item.title: sttr completion zsh
item.description: sttr completion zsh # generate the autocompletion script for zsh Synopsis # Generate the autocompletion script for the zsh shell. If shell completion is not already enabled in your environment you will need to enable it. You can execute the following once: $ echo “autoload -U compinit; compinit” » ~/.zshrc To load completions for every new session, execute once: Linux: # $ sttr completion zsh > “${fpath[1]}/_sttr”
